SENT.plain: Association of aggressive jejunal carcinoid tumors and other primary gastrointestinal neoplasms are rarely observed
We describe the case of a synchronous jejunal carcinoid tumor and two colorectal polyps in a 78-year old woman
Surgical intervention was performed for the colorectal tumors and the carcinoid was incidentally found
It was well differentiated but was accompanied by lymph node metastasis and peritoneal carcinomatosis
In this case, the prognosis was not depending by the colorectal tumors but the aggressive feature of jejunal carcinoid lead to patient's death
